file_insights.change_summary: Replaced CSS property borderRight with borderInlineEnd for RTL/LTR language support

patterns_discovered.description: Systematic replacement of directional CSS properties with logical properties for internationalization support
patterns_discovered.purpose: Enable RTL/LTR language switching without separate stylesheets

patterns_discovered.description: Focused, minimal changes targeting specific CSS properties rather than bulk refactoring
patterns_discovered.benefit: Reduces risk and makes changes easily reviewable

gotchas_discovered.description: borderInlineEnd is a newer CSS logical property; requires checking browser support for target browsers
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Verify browser support matrix for project's supported versions

gotchas_discovered.description: This change only affects Sidebar; other components may have similar borderRight usage that needs consistent migration
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Ensure systematic migration across all layout/UI components

approach_outcome.objective: Migrate Sidebar component to use logical CSS properties
approach_outcome.result_summary: Successfully replaced borderRight with borderInlineEnd in Sidebar component styling

recommendations.recommendation: Conduct component-wide audit to identify all instances of directional CSS properties (borderRight, marginRight, paddingLeft, etc.) that should be replaced with logical equivalents
Add visual regression tests for RTL layout to ensure borderInlineEnd renders correctly in both LTR and RTL contexts
Document the i18n CSS migration strategy and create checklist for future component updates
Verify and document minimum browser versions supporting logical CSS properties like borderInlineEnd
